args:
Faris's team visits a priest who they believe
has evidence that Cardinal Graht is behind the
recent string of incidents. They secure his help,
but when his daughter is taken hostage, he kills
himself and the apostles are arrested.
A few days earlier, at a North Grastaea inn...
Let's go over what we've learned so far.
Following Nevin's deductions, we looked\ninto the vault logs for withdrawals of the\nsealing stone prior to the wroth incident.
There, we found records of Basileus taking\na number of items and records out of\nstorage on the orders of Cardinal Graht.
Obviously, there was no explicit record\nof the sealing stone itself being taken.\nBasileus is a traitor, not an imbecile.
But the fact remains that the stone was\ntaken, and every fiber in my body is\nscreaming that he was behind it.
Your intuition is rarely wrong, and I agree\nthat Graht is the ringleaderâ€”but we still\ncan't accuse him on a hunch.
Yes, of course. We need evidence.
Precisely. For evil to be properly judged,\na clear case must be made based on law\nand supported by concrete evidence.
Or we could skip all that, round up the\nguy we know is responsible, and just\nknock off early for the day!
Do you two rehearse that, or is it just some\nweird parent-child telepathy thing?\nRegardless, it really sucks!
Let's get back on track. What do you two\nthink our next move should be?
Precedent would have us investigate the\ncardinal and look for evidence to prove\nhis involvement in these incidents.
Sadly, now is a bad time to mount an\ninvestigation into Graht.

Huh? ...Oh, riiiight! It's time for the annual
Auspecalia festival! I guess it's hard to
sniff around during a huge ritual
celebration of the Auspex, huh?

Security around the Curia always becomes
exceptionally tight this time of year, and
even our status as apostles won't permit
us to wander about freely.
Which means if we want evidence,\nwe'll need to focus on people in Graht's\norbit as opposed to the man himself.
Excellent, Ryszarda. Full marks. However,\nthe problem we face now is that Graht's\norbit is far from small.

Thankfully, I managed to track down a few
key individuals. It seems the one woven
deepest in Graht's web is a priest by the
name of Father Mugra.
Let's see... 36 years old. Wife passed\naway 15 years ago. Only living family is\na daughter, age 16.
He's had dealings with Cardinal Graht for\nroughly a decade, and even now the two\nmeet multiple times a month.
He began making regular trips to South\nGrastaea shortly after first meeting Graht,\nbut the purpose of the visits is unknown.

The official story is that he's serving as
a sort of goodwill ambassador to ease
tensions with the southern branch of the
Church, but I have my doubts.
Also, further investigation turned up a link\nbetween him and Lay the Hands.
Lay the Hands. They are a philanthropic\ngroup who travel from battlefield to\nbattlefield treating the wounded.
Huh. And here I thought I was the only one\ncrazy enough to do that. Good on 'em!

Unfortunately, their medic work is a front,
and they truck less in hands than armsâ€”
the illegal sort. It seems some of those
weapons made their way to Graht.
I take back everything I just said.
We also suspect Mugra worked with a\npriest of the southern Church to spread\nslander about {player_name}.
Sounds like a guy with a lot to shareâ€”\nlet's squeeze him like an overripe lemon!\nEr, but we ARE sure he's guilty, right?

All but certainly. And if we need further
backing to our suspicions, he repeatedly
met with the priest in the wroth case just
before it happened.
But again, we lack decisive evidence.\nIf we press him and he elects to stonewall\nus, there is little we can do about it.

Well, I'm not a fan of just sitting on our
hands while this guy prays the day away.
Sunlight's the best disinfectant for lies,
and I say we cook him in it!

A chilling take for certain. And yet if hard
evidence is not forthcoming, we may find
ourselves with no choice but to resort to
less elegant means.
Whoa, hang on just a minute!
Look, before you decide to break out the\nhot pokers, at least let me talk to the man.
Do you have a plan in mind?
Well, not so much a plan as...
Look, this priest is clearly devoted to his\ncause, and any use of force on our end\nwill likely just make him dig his heels in.

If we want intelligence on the cardinal,
I believe our best chance is to try sitting
down and talking with Father Mugra.
Um...that's my opinion, anyway.

Another hunch, is it? Very well, we will
leave it to you for now. But if you sense
this man is giving you the runaround,
you are to subdue him at once.
Let's see where your gut leads us.
Yes, sir! I'll do my best!
Yes, that's me. Is there something I can\nhelp you with, child?
Oh, no, I...I just had a couple questions.\nThat is, if you don't mind.
I'll take that as a yes. And given that you're\nknocking on my door now, I assume this\nhas to do with Cardinal Graht.

Let me spare you some effort: I have
nothing whatsoever to say, and no amount
of sniffing about or skulduggery will turn
up any incriminating evidence.

Given that, how would you like to proceed?
Will you bring me in and force me to talk?
Frankly, you don't strike me as a woman
with the stomach for torture.
If that is all, I ask that you be on your way.\nI have prayers which need to be said.
This may be a strange thing to ask a priest,\nbut what are you praying so hard about?
You seem to be in a good deal of pain\nwhen you pray. Your face shows...doubt.\nEven shame.
Is it possible you feel regret? That you\nnever intended to get mixed up in all this\nand you now suffer under that burden?
If so, it might help to share even a little of\nyour story. If there is some way we might\nbe able to help, we promise to try.
...As you no doubt know, I have a childâ€”\na daughter named Nebula. My wife's \ngreatest gift to me.

Sadly, she has been frail since birth,
frequently ill, and rarely able to go
outdoors. Even now she lies bedridden
in a most sorry and critical state.
I am all she has, which is why I cannot\nallow myself to be taken away.
All the more reason not to get involved in\nshady dealings. So why did you?
As I said, her illness is grave and not\neasily treatedâ€”but Cardinal Graht offered\nher a chance.
She cannot live without his continued\nsupport. I have no choice but to do\nwhatever he asks.
I'm certain poor Nebula would be\ndevastated to learn her father became\na criminal because of her...
That's why you look so pained when\nyou pray, isn't it?
I know you don't want to hurt Nebula,\nFather Mugra. Please, talk to us.

No child wants to see their parent suffer.
Does your daughter not deserve a life with
a father who knows some small modicum
of happiness?
Enough, Ryszarda. Show some mercy to\nthe poor man.
All I ever wanted was for my daughter to\nlive a long and happy life, the same as\nany other girl.
In that case, you should have come to me\ninstead of that dodgy cardinalâ€”but it's\nnot too late to change that decision.

I've been all over the world, and I've got
my share of connections. Heck, we could
even leave her with that goody-two-shoes
crew for a while.
By that, are you referring to Prince\n{player_name} at the Halidom?
Yep! I'm not usually one to owe favors,\nbut we could make an exception this time.\nPut in a special request, like.
No need for the cardinal's help means no\nreason to cover for himâ€”and no reason to\nkeep digging yourself in deeper.
Well? Whatcha think? Pretty sweet deal,\nif you ask me.
And one wildly above your authority\nto proffer.
Sorry, but I know how this guy feels.\nI mean, I'm basically a parent myself.\nYou're with me on this, right, Uriel?
Issues of protocol aside, I share in the\nsentimentâ€”and I also see room for\nclemency in Father Mugra's circumstance.
I'm on the side of any dad who puts his kid\nfirst. But if you want to laugh about all this\nwith your daughter someday, start talking.
...You have been most helpful. This intel\ngives us a clear picture of Graht's dealings.\nTen points extra credit.

I'm just shocked at how awful it all is.
Declaring an entire village heretics and
burning it down just to serve as a test run
for a new weapon is beyond the pale.
That was over a decade ago now, but I still\nhear them screaming in my dreams.\nA purer vision of hell, there never was.
I'm more shocked that he's managed to\noperate this boldly for so long without\never being exposed.

I'm sure there were those who tried,
but Graht has a talent for silencing
detractors. Truly unforgivable.
Failing grade!

The cardinal has pulled the strings behind
countless incidents in the past, but you'll
doubtless find them severed if you attempt
to follow them this far behind.
However, the strings on his current plot\nshould still be intact. I suggest you follow\nthose back to Graht.
And just which plot are we speaking of?
I don't know his reasons. I only know that\nhe is dead set on making it happen.
Then the slander he had that priest of the\nsouthern Church spread is a part of that\nbroader plan?
Yes. Additionally, I hear he's close to\nacquiring a tool that will permit him to\nstrike a decisive blow in his war.
The Demonlord Satan himself, unless I\nmiss my guess. Yes, the puzzle pieces\nare finally starting to come together...
We need you to share your story in a more\npublic setting, Father. It is time to bring\nCardinal Graht down for good.
Of course. And while I know it won't undo\nthe harm I've done in abetting his evil all\nthese years, perhaps it is a start.
I'll do whatever I must to forge a future\nwhere my daughter views me with pride.
Well said, Dad! Then let's get moving.\nI guess our first step is to get Nebula\nover to the Halidom, huh?
Please. Once I know she's safe, I'll be able\nto give my testimony without fear.
Then visiting your daughter is our next\nstop. Where can we find her?
Near the church. I'll take you there.
Yes? Is that bird a problem?
Hey, stop! What are you doing?!
That's a gaolstone! Did that raven\nbring it here?

Careful, now. That's an artifact that
absorbs the surrounding mana to emit a
superheated blast. You won't even leave
ashes behind if you're caught in its wake.
I can dodge just fineâ€”I'm a lot more\nworried about the town around us!
Why did you do this, Father Mugra?\nWhat happened to forging a future where\nyou and Nebula can finally be happy?!
I'm truly sorry, my child... But if I don't do\nthis, Nebula will be murdered!
Are you saying she's been taken hostage?\nImpossible! They didn't have had the time!
If only I'd met you all sooner, perhaps...\nForgive me, but I cannot help you now.
Farewell, my dear little Nebula...\nDaddy will always love you.
No casualties on our side, but Mugra is...
This is too cruel. He only wanted a simple\nlife with his daughter like any other family.\nIt isn't fair!

Apostles Faris and Ryszarda!
Archangels Uriel and Raphael!
You are all under arrest for the murder
of Father Mugra!
Uh, are you really dumb, or did you not\njust see what happened here?
Silence! Any further resistance will be met\nwith lethal force.
They got here far too quickly. The only way\nany of this makes sense is if someone\nalready knew how it would play out.
Of course we got here quickly! You sent\na notice of your intent along with your\nheretic's manifesto!
We walked right into his trap.
So what's the plan? Do we take these guys\non and fight our way free?
We can't afford to be taken into custody\njust yet. If we're going down, it has to at\nleast be 300â€”no, 180 seconds from now.
Okay, that is a VERY specific timeframe.
Fighting here will only harm our position.\nJust buy me those 180 seconds, all right?\nAfter that, turn yourselves in peacefully.
Enough chatter! Hold out your hands so\nwe might shackle youâ€”BLARGH!
I still have no idea what's happening,\nbut I've got the next three minutes to go\nwild, and I'm totally gonna do it! Wheeee!
I'm deducting points. I just explained that\nfighting would only harm... Oh, forget it.\nUriel! We must withdraw for now!
Those two are trying to run! After them!
No! I'm not letting you go anywhere!
Sorry, folks, but I only have time to play\none round, so gimme all you got!
Pull yourselves together, you fools!\nBring the lot of them down by force!
Grams\nCuria of the Ilian Church of Grams
Yes, Your Eminence. They put up a fierce\nresistance, but all four are now in chains.
They're being held in separate cells.
Everything is progressing smoothly.\nAt this rate, we'll have the situation in\nRozcimea handled ahead of schedule...
